intro: Chortolirion stenophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved chortolirion, is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white or pale blue flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
